title: Dry Mouth Remedies: Home and Natural Remedies That Work
author: Adrian White
description: Dry mouth happens when the glands that produce saliva aren't working well. It's also called xerostomia or hyposalivation. It's not considered an official diagnosable condition, but it's sometimes a symptom of another condition. Dry mouth can be very uncomfortable, but home remedies can provide relief.
cleaned_text: If you're experiencing dry mouth, there are several home remedies you can try to help relieve your symptoms, such as drinking water, using alcohol-free mouthwash, or trying an over-the-counter saliva substitute. [Dry mouth](/symptom/dry-mouth) happens when the glands that produce saliva aren't working well. It's also called xerostomia or hyposalivation. It's not considered an official diagnosable condition, but it's sometimes a symptom of another condition. Dry mouth can be very uncomfortable, but home remedies can provide relief. These remedies aren't proven to cure dry mouth, only to relieve it. 1. Drink water Sipping water and staying hydrated can help relieve dry mouth. [Studies](http://europepmc.org/abstract/med/22201100) have found that [dehydration](/symptom/dehydration) may be a factor in dry mouth. Increasing your [water intake](/health/how-much-water-should-I-drink) can help treat mild dehydration. 2. Avoid certain medications More than [90 percent](http://jadekimdds.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/08/dry-mouth.pdf) of dry mouth cases are caused by medications. [One study review](https://link.springer.com/content/pdf/10.1007%2Fs40268-016-0153-9.pdf) found that common types of medication that may cause dry mouth include: - antihistamines - antihypertensives - hormone medications [bronchodilators](https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/bronchodilators/side-effects/) If you think your medication is causing your dry mouth, talk to your doctor. Never suddenly stop taking a medication without your doctor's approval. 3. Kick dehydrating habits Here are some recommendations: - Avoid caffeine. Caffeinated beverages can be dehydrating. have found that drinking caffeinated coffee or tea causes dry mouth. [Studies](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/pdf/10.1111/jre.12183) - Limit alcohol use. Alcohol may dehydrate, which can contribute to dry mouth. When experiencing dry mouth, try drinking water instead of alcohol. Interestingly though, alcohol use isn't a proven risk factor. This was tested and established in studies . [like this](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/epdf/10.1111/j.1834-7819.2011.01347.x) - Stop smoking. Smoking tobacco can also dehydrate. Cutting down or quitting may reduce dry mouth symptoms. A found that smoking increased dry mouth issues. However, in a [2014 study](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3939554/) , being a smoker wasn't an associated risk factor. [2011 review](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/epdf/10.1111/j.1834-7819.2011.01347.x) - Drop sugar. Like caffeine, alcohol, and smoking, sugar may dehydrate you. If you can, try cutting down on sugary foods to reduce dry mouth problems. Avoidance of sugar, particularly sugar-containing beverages, was recommended in this [2015 study](https://scholarworks.iupui.edu/handle/1805/9211). 4. Suck on sugarless candies Sucking on a sugar-free candy may provide some short-term relief from dry mouth. This includes products like cough drops, lozenges, or other candies. 5. Chew sugarless gum Sugar-free gum can also provide short-term relief from dry mouth. Also, some gum contains [xylitol](/nutrition/xylitol-101), which helps stimulate saliva production. 6. Improve overall oral care Dry mouth may be both a symptom and a cause of poor oral hygiene. Improving oral routines [could be crucial](https://www.nidcr.nih.gov/health-info/dry-mouth/more-info#treatment) 7. Use alcohol-free mouthwash Mouthwash is effective in improving overall oral hygiene, which can factor into dry mouth. More specifically, mouthwashes containing xylitol helps promote saliva production. This may provide short-term relief, as mentioned in [this 2015 review](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4278738/) 8. Avoid breathing through your mouth Mouth-breathing can make dry mouth worse and cause other [oral health problems](/health/mouth-breathing). Try breathing through your nose more often than your mouth, especially when experiencing any dry mouth discomfort. 9. Get a humidifier Creating humidity may help dry mouth simply by adding more moisture to your environment. [One study](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11325-015-1182-2) suggested that [humidification](/health/humidifiers-and-health) could moderately improve dry mouth symptoms. Running a humidifier at night may [reduce discomfort](https://health.clevelandclinic.org/how-you-can-tell-if-you-need-a-humidifier/) and improve sleep. 10. Herbal remedies Many herbs can help stimulate saliva production and temporarily relieve dry mouth, among them: [Aloe vera](/health/7-amazing-uses-aloe-vera)(Aloe barbadensis). The gel or juice inside aloe vera plant leaves is moisturizing for the mouth. Purchasing aloe vera juice is a great way to treat dry mouth. [Ginger](/nutrition/11-proven-benefits-of-ginger)(Zingiber officinale). Ginger is a well-known herbal sialagogue. This means it helps stimulate saliva production, which also helps dry mouth. Ginger's sialagogue action is mentioned in many studies, study](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4377061/) - Hollyhock root to aloe vera. [A 2015 study](http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/2156587215590232)showed it helped dry mouth with the help of Malva sylvestris, a close relative. [Marshmallow root](/health/food-nutrition/marshmallow-root)(Malva spp.). Marshmallow root is an emollient and moisturizing plant like aloe. It's popular in traditional herbalism. [A 2015 study](http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/2156587215590232)showed it helped dry mouth with the help of Alcea digitata, a close relative. [Nopal cactus](/health/nopal)(Opuntia spp.). Nopal cactus is a traditional food and medicine from Mexico. Also called [prickly pear cactus](/health/food-nutrition/prickly-pear-recipes), it's gaining popularity in the health industry. [A 2017 study](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/13880209.2017.1347188?scroll=top&needAccess=true)showed nopal could Spilanthes (Spilanthes acmella). Spilanthes is a popular herb used for improving dental health. One traditional use is as a sialagogue for increasing salivation, which may [help peppers promote salivation. 11. Try over-the-counter saliva substitutes You can purchase saliva substitutes at your local pharmacy. Many different brands offer saliva substitutes, such as xerostom. These products are great for short-term relief but probably won't cure the cause of your dry mouth. Having dry mouth is rarely a serious issue. Sometimes it's a sign you're just a bit dehydrated. See your doctor: - If you think medications are the cause. It's best to discuss going off medications before discontinuing their use. - If you have symptoms of other conditions also. Other conditions include: If these conditions are causing your dry mouth, treating the underlying condition will be more effective than home remedies.
